title: Researcher Type Graph
question_text:
Suppose a researcher is measuring the weight of $100$ randomly chosen subjects.
What is the best type of graphical display to use to display the weights of these 100 individuals?
solution:
A stem plot would be the best way to graph this quantitative data. Stem plots are always appropriate to graph single variable, quantitative data.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; pie charts deal only with categorical data.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; a scatterplot is used only to plot bivariate data.

Choice 'D' is incorrect; bar graphs deal only with categorical data.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; the range of this data is so large that a dot plot would do a poor job of showing the shape of this distribution.
